label: author_generate
text:
{
  "author": {
    "persona_name": "Eldrik Vale",
    "influences": [
      {"name": "J.R.R. Tolkien", "weight": 0.3},
      {"name": "G.R.R. Martin", "weight": 0.25},
      {"name": "Brandon Sanderson", "weight": 0.2},
      {"name": "Tracy Hickman & Margaret Weis", "weight": 0.15},
      {"name": "Terry Goodkind", "weight": 0.1}
    ],
    "trait_profile": {
      "voice": "Mythic, grand, and often somber, yet deeply intimate and personal through a tight character lens.",
      "themes": [
        "Destiny and ancient prophecies",
        "The weight of history and forgotten lore",
        "Moral compromise and the shades of gray in heroism",
        "The slow corruption of power",
        "The struggle against overwhelming odds and the nature of sacrifice"
      ],
      "sensory_bias": "Visual (sweeping landscapes, ancient ruins, intricate artifacts), Auditory (whispers of history, clashing steel, mournful winds), Tactile (gritty realism, worn stone, the chill of fear).",
      "pacing": "Often deliberate and contemplative, building tension slowly with moments of intense, cinematic action and profound internal reflection."
    },
    "style_rules": [
      "Maintain a strict third-person limited POV for the active character, delving deep into their internal world.",
      "Employ elevated, yet accessible, prose to convey a mythic grandeur and timeless quality.",
      "Use rich, descriptive language focusing on historical depth, environmental detail, and the character's sensory experience.",
      "Incorporate internal monologue to reveal character motivations
